subject: Data
title: Power Laws: When Bell Curves Don't Apply
description: A fast breakdown of Power Laws: When Bell Curves Don't Apply for builders.

hook.text: The richest 1% own more than the bottom 50%. That's not a bell curve. It's a power law.

buildup.text: Power law distributions have extreme outliers â€” a few giants and a massive number of small values.

discovery.text: Vilfredo Pareto noticed this in 1896: 80% of Italy's land was owned by 20% of the population.

twist.text: Power laws appear in city sizes, word frequencies, website traffic, and earthquake magnitudes.

climax.text: Assuming bell curves where power laws rule leads to catastrophic underestimates of extreme events.

punchline.text: Not all data follows the bell. Some follows the volcano.

quiz.question: What characterizes a power law distribution?
options: A few extreme values and many small ones
